Name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis;"Causes tuberculosis (TB); resistance to first-line drugs like rifampicin and isoniazid (multi-drug resistant TB or MDR-TB)
Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)
Description: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) is resistant to most beta-lactam antibiotics

Name: Escherichia coli (E. coli);"Common cause of urinary tract infections (UTIs); increasing resistance to antibiotics like ciprofloxacin
Klebsiella pneumoniae;"Associated with hospital-acquired infections; resistant to carbapenems
Pseudomonas aeruginosa;"Causes infections in hospital settings
Neisseria gonorrhoeae;"Cause of gonorrhea; developing resistance to ceftriaxone and azithromycin
Enterococcus faecium (VRE)
Description: Vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus (VRE) is resistant to vancomycin

Name: Salmonella spp.;"Causes foodborne illness; increasing resistance to fluoroquinolones and third-generation cephalosporins
Shigella spp.;"Causes dysentery; resistant to trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole
Campylobacter jejuni;"Common cause of bacterial gastroenteritis; resistance to fluoroquinolones and macrolides such as azithromycin."
Haemophilus influenzae;"Can cause respiratory infections; increasing resistance to beta-lactams and macrolides."
Proteus mirabilis;"Known for causing UTIs and wound infections; increasingly resistant to beta-lactams and fluoroquinolones."
Citrobacter freundii;"Can cause hospital-acquired infections; resistance to beta-lactams and carbapenems."
Morganella morganii;"Found in hospital settings and can cause UTIs and sepsis; resistant to multiple antibiotics
